Jwt._WARNING_: NEVER commit real JWT keys to version control!
Jwt._SECURITY_: Use environment variables or secure vaults (Azure Key Vault, AWS Secrets Manager)
Jwt._EXAMPLE_ENV_: Set JWT__Key environment variable instead of hardcoding
Jwt._KEY_REQUIREMENTS_: Minimum 32 characters (256 bits). Use cryptographically secure random generator
Jwt._KEY_ROTATION_: Rotate keys regularly. Support multiple valid keys during transition period

_INSTRUCTIONS_: 2. Create a new project or select existing project
4. Go to 'Credentials' and create 'OAuth 2.0 Client ID'
5. Add authorized redirect URIs (e.g., http://localhost:5000/signin-google, https://your-domain.com/signin-google)
6. Copy Client ID and Client Secret here
7. NEVER commit real credentials to version control
8. Use environment variables in production: Authentication__Google__ClientId and Authentication__Google__ClientSecret
